news_header: Bosnia-Herzegovina has declared a state of emergency due to natural disasters caused by floods and landslides.
news_text: Floods and landslides in Bosnia-Herzegovina have resulted in at least 22 deaths, with six people still missing as new heavy rains are expected. Authorities issued evacuation orders for the southern regions of Jablanica and Konjic, where 19 fatalities occurred. Infrastructure such as roads, railways, and bridges has been severely damaged, isolating several areas. Many homes and vehicles have been buried under mud and water. Emergency assistance has been sent from four different countries through the EU's civil protection mechanism to support local rescue efforts.
